Package projet

Class Model

java.lang.Object
projet.Model
public class Model extends Object
Model class: contains all the methods and is used for terminal mode
Author:
HAFID Yahya 71800678, OUBADIA Tanel 71806010

    max_div​(Model.Plane rec, Model.Polynom p, Model.Complex c, int max_iter, char JORM)

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model​(String p, String c, String x) throws NumberFormatException, Exception
      Model class constructor: contains all the basic methods
      Parameters:
      p - polynomial in string form: ax^n +bx^n-1 ... +zx^0
      c - complex in string for: a +bi
      x - plane in string form: (x,step) or (x,y,step) or (x1,x2,y1,y2,step) without the brackets
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if we try to parse a string to an int/double
      Exception - we throw an exception if the format is not respected

    • affichage

      public static void affichage​(BufferedImage img, String dirname)
      Creates a png file of the image specified. If the dirname already exists, deletes it and creates a new one.
      Parameters:
      img - the image to save (BufferedImage)
      dirname - the location where to save the image

    • max_div

      public static int max_div​(Model.Plane rec, Model.Polynom p, Model.Complex c, int max_iter, char JORM)
      This method is used to calculate the maximum iterations while using all the points of rec as reference. max_iter creates confusion in some cases since it doesn't include all the points. This is only used for the fading colors in our result image.
      Parameters:
      rec - the complex plane where we are working
      p - the polynom we are working with
      c - the complex we are working with
      max_iter - max iterations until convergence
      JORM - if j, it's a Julia set, else it's a Mandelbrot one
      Returns:
      the maximum iterations using all the points in rec as reference

    • createImage

      public static BufferedImage createImage​(Model.Plane rec, Model.Polynom p, Model.Complex c, int max_iter, char JORM)
      Creates a BufferedImage representation of a Julia/Mandelbrot set
      Parameters:
      rec - the complex plane where we are working
      p - the polynom we are working with
      c - the complex we are working with
      max_iter - max iterations until convergence
      JORM - if j, it's a Julia set, else it's a Mandelbrot one
      Returns:
      the buffered image made out of these parameters
